result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Garcia

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Garcia in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for James Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has xompleted the essay. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours in order to receive the benefits of the agreatment
,
Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Traffic Safety Course Completion

Defendant James Garcia in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Deferred Agreement, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The Court reviewed the agreement with the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant was examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint.  Court approved the deferred agreement and WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  

All parties notified that this case will be assigned to Judge Cynthia Davis, Branch 21.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant James Garcia in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a DPA hearing.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Garcia in court with Attorney Michael Fuentes who appears on behalf of Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant James Garcia in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant James Garcia in custody.  John E. Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
